name: pyBrew
tagline: An open source beer brewing program for extract brewers
body:
### Welcome to pyBrew
pyBrew is a simple, free software for home brewers as an alternative to BeerSmith or similar programs.
You can download the source code from GitHub, or get a pre-compiled Windows installer for the [latest release](https://github.com/tgvoskuilen/pyBrew/releases)

### Program Features

 * Create projects to track grain bill, hops used, yeast used, fermentation behavior, and general notes for each of your brewing projects
 * Compare your beer's properties against a number of pre-defined styles
 * Add grains, hops, and yeast to your project from editable databases of ingredients 
![project-grains](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1333980/2428448/c8aa0a58-ac48-11e3-8757-69e4528c16ea.png)

 * Calculate the tank pressure and line length for your keg system by inputting the refrigerator temperature and desired carbonation 
![kegging-calculator](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1333980/2428441/aeaee77c-ac48-11e3-9833-f8a247f0cf3c.png)

 * Calculate bitterness (IBU) using four different formulas from Dr. Hall's Zymurgy article
![project-hops](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1333980/2428449/cd33094e-ac48-11e3-98f7-0eb76ff86a00.png)
